events.originalText: Environmental Protection Agency personnel accidentally caused a spillage of 3 million gallons (11 ML) of mine waste water and tailings trapped inside the Gold King Mine near Silverton, Colorado, U.S.
events.subtitle: United States Environmental Protection Agency
events.headline: EPA Causes 3 Million Gallon Spillage at Gold King Mine in Colorado

events.originalText: An American white supremacist carried out a mass shooting at a Sikh temple in Oak Creek, Wisconsin, killing six people and wounding four others.
events.subtitle: White supremacy
events.headline: White Supremacist Mass Shooting at Sikh Temple Leaves Six Dead in Wisconsin

events.originalText: NASA launched the Juno probe to Jupiter as part of the New Frontiers program.
events.subtitle: Juno (spacecraft)
events.headline: NASA Launches Juno Probe to Jupiter

events.originalText: Wizards of the Coast released Magic: The Gathering, the first trading card game.
events.subtitle: Wizards of the Coast
events.headline: Wizards of the Coast Releases Magic: The Gathering Trading Card Game

events.originalText: A Biman Bangladesh Airlines aircraft crashed while attempting to land in Dhaka, killing 49 people in the deadliest aviation accident in Bangladeshi history.
events.subtitle: Biman Bangladesh Airlines
events.headline: Biman Bangladesh Airlines Crash Kills 49 in Dhaka

events.originalText: U.S. president Ronald Reagan fired the 11,345 striking members of the Professional Air Traffic Controllers Organization en masse.
events.subtitle: Ronald Reagan
events.headline: President Reagan Fires 11,345 Air Traffic Controllers

events.originalText: Police raided a screening of the film Lonesome Cowboys in Atlanta, Georgia, leading to the creation of the Gay Liberation Front.
events.subtitle: Lonesome Cowboys police raid
events.headline: Police Raid Leads to Creation of Gay Liberation Front in Atlanta

events.originalText: American actress and model Marilyn Monroe was found dead of a barbiturate overdose in her home in Brentwood, Los Angeles.
events.subtitle: Marilyn Monroe
events.headline: Actress Marilyn Monroe Found Dead of Overdose in Los Angeles Home

events.originalText: An earthquake registering 6.4 Ms struck near Ambato, Ecuador, killing 5,050 people.
events.subtitle: 1949 Ambato earthquake
events.headline: Earthquake in Ecuador Kills 5,050 Near Ambato

events.originalText: First World War: The British Empire's Sinai and Palestine campaign began with a victory at the Battle of Romani.
events.subtitle: World War I
events.headline: British Empire Begins Sinai and Palestine Campaign with Victory at Battle of Romani

events.originalText: Bertha Benz made the first long-distance automobile trip, driving 106 km (66 mi) from Mannheim to Pforzheim, Germany, in a Benz Patent-Motorwagen (pictured).
events.subtitle: Bertha Benz
events.headline: Bertha Benz Completes First Long-Distance Automobile Trip in Germany

events.originalText: Sir John Barrow, secretary at the Admiralty, rejected a proposal to use Francis Ronalds's electrical telegraph, deeming it "wholly unnecessary".
events.subtitle: Sir John Barrow, 1st Baronet
events.headline: John Barrow Rejects Proposal for Electrical Telegraph

events.originalText: Russia, Prussia and Habsburg Austria began the First Partition of Poland, whose primary motive was to restore the regional balance of power in Eastern Europe.
events.subtitle: Russian Empire
events.headline: Russia, Prussia, and Austria Begin First Partition of Poland

events.originalText: Austro-Turkish War: The Ottoman army were defeated in their attempt to capture the Habsburgs-controlled Petrovaradin Fortress despite having double the number of soldiers.
events.subtitle: Austro-Turkish War (1716–1718)
events.headline: Ottoman Army Defeated in Austro-Turkish War

events.originalText: Beaver Wars: Aggravated by increased French incursions into their territory, a large force of Mohawk warriors substantially destroyed the settlement of Lachine, New France.
events.subtitle: Beaver Wars
events.headline: Mohawk Warriors Destroy Lachine Settlement in New France

events.originalText: Beaver Wars: Aggravated by increased French incursions into their territory, a large force of Mohawk warriors substantially destroyed the settlement of Lachine in present-day Quebec.
events.subtitle: Beaver Wars
events.headline: Mohawk Warriors Destroy Lachine Settlement in Quebec

events.originalText: Scottish nobleman John Ruthven, 3rd Earl of Gowrie, was killed during what was most likely a failed attempt to kidnap King James VI.
events.subtitle: John Ruthven, 3rd Earl of Gowrie
events.headline: Earl of Gowrie Killed in Failed Kidnapping Attempt of King James VI

events.originalText: Muscovite–Lithuanian Wars: The Grand Duchy of Lithuania achieved one of the greatest Lithuanian victories against the Tatars in the Battle of Kletsk.
events.subtitle: Muscovite–Lithuanian Wars
events.headline: Lithuania Achieves Victory Against Tatars in Battle of Kletsk

events.originalText: King Alfonso X of Castile was forced to abandon the Siege of Algeciras, the first of many on the city during the Spanish Reconquista.
events.subtitle: Alfonso X of Castile
events.headline: King Alfonso X Forced to Abandon Siege of Algeciras

events.originalText: Henry I was crowned King of England in Westminster Abbey.
events.subtitle: Henry I of England
events.headline: Henry I Crowned King of England at Westminster Abbey

events.originalText: Henry I (pictured) was crowned King of England at Westminster Abbey.
events.subtitle: Henry I of England
events.headline: Henry I Crowned King of England at Westminster Abbey

events.originalText: Liu Xiu proclaimed himself the monarch of the Han dynasty as Emperor Guangwu.
events.subtitle: AD 25
events.headline: Liu Xiu Proclaims Himself Emperor Guangwu of Han Dynasty
